prior_knowledge_digest: Students are expected to have a basic understanding of language learning concepts, such as vocabulary, grammar, and sentence structure from their native language studies. Familiarity with the concept of conjugation and noun-adjective agreement in English will be beneficial. No prior knowledge of Latin is required, as this is the introductory lesson.
yesterday_recap: N/A - This is the first lesson.
misconception_watchlist: Latin is a dead language and not useful
Latin pronunciation is the same as English

primary: Introduce students to the Latin alphabet and pronunciation
Familiarize students with basic Latin greetings
Understand the significance of Latin in historical and modern contexts

lesson_flow.description: Welcome students and introduce the course objectives.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and ask any initial questions.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Set a positive and welcoming tone for the course.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the Latin alphabet and its pronunciation.
lesson_flow.student_action: Repeat after the teacher and practice pronunciation.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use audio clips to demonstrate correct pronunciation.

lesson_flow.description: Practice basic Latin greetings with the class.
lesson_flow.student_action: Engage in pair activities to practice greetings.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Circulate to provide feedback and encouragement.

lesson_flow.description: Discuss the faith phrase 'In principio erat Verbum' and its significance.
lesson_flow.student_action: Reflect on the phrase and its meaning.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Connect the phrase to the importance of language.

lesson_flow.description: Review key points of the lesson and preview the next class.
lesson_flow.student_action: Ask questions and note down any assignments.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage students to practice pronunciation at home.
